body:
Some ideas (kinda a note to self) 
- Instead of representing foreign relations in `Collection` we should another enumeration to `Value` maybe `Relationship`. The problem with this is it can't be statically represented. This shouldn't matter as our read requests will undergo join decomposition.
- `Property` assumes a flat data structure, it should be swapped out for a `Pointer` where possible.
I actually think using `Box<Filter>` for recursion would be fine. Do you have any objections?

@svmnotn Made some changes, tell me what you think. I didn't check but I _think_ it compiles because I got no lint errors.

Also, what do you know about ranges in rust? I think we either need to move the `Range` struct to its own module or use another more idiomatic implementation.

It does compile (Added travis so that we definitely know that)
and you might want to look at [Range](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/struct.Range.html) and [ops](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ops/index.html)
@svmnotn that's actually perfect, except is there an enum for all the range-ish types? `Range`, `RangeFrom`, `RangeTo`, and `RangeFull`? Our range can be any of these.
maybe a trait they all impl?  like [RangeArgument](https://doc.rust-lang.org/collections/range/trait.RangeArgument.html)
Thanks. I'm going to convert the `Request` enum a to driver functions and I'll use that.
Wait, actually `RangeArgument` is unstable…does this matter?
can you get it to compile? as currently it does not
Yay, it compiles. Think it's ready to merge 🙌 🎉
I don't see anything glaringly wrong with it
... this is weird. It builds just fine on my machine
Mmm. The dark arts of unsafe rust?
can you try building it on your computer?
Do I just run `scripts/build-tests.sh`?
Also, how familiar are you with `Makefile`s?
you have to modify it since you are in mac, and I've seen them, not use tho
I tried `TRAVIS_OS_NAME=osx scripts/build-tests.sh`. Nothing crashed.
ok good I guess

are you running the latest?
Just made your script work without an env variable and reduced duplication. I'll run the tests again 😊

You didn't push the fixed script... also you realize that the lib endings are different right?
Or at least they should be

... I have no clue what is going on at this point... and I can't test it....

Tested on Windows 7 64bit, no segfault found.
To note:

This happened on a clean install of Rust + a just downloaded version of the latest from this branch with some changes to improve code reuse: 90362fc
Tests also pass on a clean install of rust + the latest commit, on a 32bit mint install
